conclusion: Analyze changes in electric field and potential at the center of the triangle due to charges.
Equilateral triangle with vertices A, B, C; center labeled O. Like charges at A and B, opposite charge at C.
Initially, electric field at O due to charges at A and B is zero because fields cancel out.
Electric potential at O is determined by charges at A and B.
With opposite charge at C, electric field at O is determined by difference in fields from A, B, and C.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O remains E because charges at A and B are unchanged.
Electric potential at O changes due to charge at C; potential is sum of initial potential and potential due to C.
Potential change is equal to potential of charge at C since potential at infinity is 0.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O is E, electric potential at O is 2E.
